717709f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 114th Street (West)
717709f-a.text:
Broadway, north from West 114th Street, and showing on the east side
of this thoroughfare, units of Columbia University. In the right back-
grOund appears the tower atop the Administration Building of the Union
Theological Seminary, another unit of this educational enterprise.
September 3, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717707f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 114th Street (West)
717707f-a.text:
Broadway, north from but not including West 114th Street, showing
workmen working on sewer and water main chhanges.incident to the proposed
construction of the Interborough Rapid Transit Co. subway. It was found
necessarv, in view of the proposed subway, to make drastic changes in
the layout of mains. (See New York Times, December 2, 1900, Page 14,
column 1). In the right background is shown Havemever Hall, a unit of
Columbia University between West 116th and West 120th Streets, and left;
Barnard College, at the N.W. corner of West 119th Street.
October 30, 1900.
Board of Transportation Photograph.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
Williams B. Parsons Collection.

717708f-b.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 114th Street (West)
717708f-b.text:
(1)
Broadway, north from West 114th Street, showing on the west side
(left),three apartment houses the Luxor, Regnor and Rexor that face
units of Columbia University (right). The latter in the order of their
appearance are: Furnald Hall, the School of Journalism, the School for
Business and the School of Mines.
September 3, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
A view solely of the University Building and grounds. Note the
gabled house, at the N.E. corner of Broadway and West 114th Street.
September 3, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
A detail of No. 2, showing the aforementioned cottage. .ON.the
extreme right appears a portion of South Hall and Library.
September 3, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

715094f-a.text:
544-545 West 114th Street, south side, east of Broadway.
About 1911.
